author: ryanleeschneider
content: How does one get the full blob from a tx on devnet-8?  For example this blobscan tx? https://blobscan.com/tx/0x857d3783098e9b0e0fc8b3d5278360a2178f5699f7d96cf5ff29e16b40b6ce6b I found the blob here in the explorer: https://light-beaconchain-explorer.dencun-devnet-8.ethpandaops.io/slot/175476 is that using beacon chain APIs to get the data?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Actually how do I know which of the three sidecars is for the above tx?

author: pk910
content:
Yes, there is a beacon api for it:
https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Beacon/getBlobSidecars
The actual tx is a special type 3 tx that links to the committment

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Thanks! Is there a public beacon API for devnet-8 available? Is didn’t see one listed on the eth panda ops site.  Also how do I know which blob aligns with which 4844 tx in the block?  Basically trying to figure out if I have a tx hash of a recent blob tx how I would get the actual blob from there. Or more specifically how I would recreate the entire “network payload” of that tx.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: The tx has the blob versioned hashes but how do I go from that to a commitment?

author: pk910
content:
I think you'll need to do it the other way round. 
You get a list of commitments from the beacon block and you can get the versioned hash from each of these via:
`blob_versioned_hash = 0x01 + sha256(commitment)[1:]`
then compare the versioned hash with what is linked from the tx
